name: ConfigurationAssist
tagline: A project to simplify reading app/web config files in .Net
body:
# Description

Currently ConfigurationAssist supports the following:

* Mapping AppSettings to Config Classes
* Mapping Config Sections to strongly typed Config Classes
* Mapping Config Sections in Groups to strongly typed Config Classes

Its often convenient to split app/web.config keys into logical groupings. This is where Configuration Sections come in handy. Its long supported feature of .Net but can be a little tedious if you want to strongly type the section.

ConfigurationAssist is here to help remove the CRUD involved in using config sections on strongly typed object.
It will also allow mapping to the keys in AppSetting and remove the tedium of converting the keys to other primitive types.

# How to use it

I have set up some basic examples and explanations in the sub pages:

[AppSettings](https://github.com/JeremyBOB81/ConfigurationAssist/wiki/AppSettings)

[Sections - Simple](https://github.com/JeremyBOB81/ConfigurationAssist/wiki/Sections---Simple)

[Sections - Grouped](https://github.com/JeremyBOB81/ConfigurationAssist/wiki/Sections---Grouped)

[Non-String Values](https://github.com/JeremyBOB81/ConfigurationAssist/wiki/Non-String-Values)

# Installation

ConfigurationAssist is currently available on NuGet.
```
PM> Install-Package ConfigurationAssist
```
It currently supports the .NET Framework 3.5+

# Upcoming

## Config Section KeyValue Mapping

Its also possible to use a configuration section as key/value pairs similar to how AppSettings works. I want to allow wiring those types of sections into the requested class object.

## Cleaner Section Group Mapping

Currently the recommended way to map a section group is to use the provided ```ConfigurationSectionItem(sectionName, sectionGroup)``` attribute. The down side with this is that it forces the developer to capture the section name. I want to make both the section name and the sectionGroup optional parameters. This means we can specify only the sectionGroup if we want, and the section Name will use the class name for mapping.
